page.title: 03 LYMPNE VILLAGE.
page.content: Lympne,pronounced "Lim",is the second largest village.It takes its name from the ancient "River Limene"In the grounds of Studfall Castle is the site of a Roman fortress and the register of the parish church, St. Stephen,dates from 1611. It has a Post-Office,Primary school and some shops but most people think the amenities are inadequate. Like nearby Saltwood it is a mainly residential area for the surrounding towns. It has a regular bus service and is near both the main-line stations of Westernhangar and Sandling.However,most people interviewed used private transport.
